item.description:
As always, please come with an open mind, a sense of humor, and be ready for an adventure! The route will go through parts of Boston, Charlestown, Everett, Winthrop, East Boston, and then to Deer Island, and back to Boston. The route will be a mixture of busy streets and paved shared use paths. Riders should have a bike that is in good condition, can ride an average of 10 ? 15 mph, and be comfortable sharing the road with other vehicles. Helmets are a must. (here is the route)


The idea for this ride was to make it both car & train accessible, so that everyone can attend.


For those who will take the train: We will meet at the mini plaza in front of the Federal Reserve Tower adjacent to South Station. (check it out) We will LEAVE PROMPTLY at 9:30am and pedal down to the Castle Island concession stand where we will meet with the others who are driving.


For those who will drive: Meet at the Castle Island concession stand (check it out) by 10:00am, where you will be met by those of us who are coming from South Station. Map to Castle Island


After we reach Deer Island, the return route will go near the Maverick T-stop (blue line) and the Sullivan Square T-stop (orange line) so if you need to bail out a bit early and take the T home you can!

Bring some $$ because we will stop for food somewhere along the way.
Like always we are certain to have a ton of fun.

Hope you can make it!

About Deer Island
item.name: *40 Mile Ride: Boston to Deer Island
